item.title: Monetization Model: Raffles/Sweepstakes
item.description:
Host giveaways of iPhones? Mini-program ranking rewards? Various live streaming platform gift lotteries?

These seemingly unrelated things are, in essence, different monetization models for free traffic, with a hint of financial engineering

Win gifts through platform lottery

In typical scenarios, users obtain platform currency to purchase gifts for their favorite streamers. Platforms also offer another approach: instead of directly gifting, users can spend the acquired currency to enter raffles and win exclusive, high-value gifts.

There’s already a problem – online lotteries are essentially platforms running casinos. With enough participants, they’re guaranteed to be profitable. 屌丝 Users participate hoping for a big win, intending to show off and gain status!

Gift from streamer (physical item)

The platform’s lottery focuses on user content. Hosts have monthly activity and popularity tasks. Enabling the gifting lottery allows fans who send designated gifts or amounts to participate, with prizes like high-end phones or cash rewards.

For popular streamers, this event is quite profitable – essentially a zero-cost purchase with enough participants to generate income. It tests the streamer’s operational skills.

Of course, there’s another way to play—with high rewards (cash value)—and many outdoor streamers use this method, essentially a form of online gambling. People don’t care about the content; users only care if they can win.

Aside from show-focused hosts, ordinary game streamers struggle to drive player spending through PK mode. Gaming and watching streams are leisure activities; people don’t typically want to spend extra money. Especially lotteries can cultivate users’ charging habits and consumption habits, occasionally leading to impulse purchases (with generous prizes, creating a desire to win).

Mini-program ranking rewards

Design a mini-program with trivial processes or offer limited gaming support. These are all cover tactics to pass Tencent’s review; the gameplay should include a ranking system. Users earn points by viewing incentivized ads and completing tasks, and the backend uses these points to determine rankings. High-ranking users receive designated rewards.

Core logic: Advertising revenue > Operating costs + Reward expenses

Even small programs can operate effectively, providing reasonable services and earning income through appropriate advertising. The earnings may not be substantial, but a steady trickle can still work.
